Thursday, August 25, 2022
8:00 PM 9:00 PM

This week we will have Ms. Remy Soubry, Founder & CEO of RS Strategies Inc., for an insightful one-hour session on Starting Up Your Business and Strategic Considerations. 

Remy Soubry is the Founder and CEO of RS Strategies Inc.; a business consulting group that was born from a passion for supporting SMBs in punching through growth plateaus. With over 10 years of experience in scaling and leading business operations, Remy is driven to bring owners, founders, team leaders, and teams the support she wishes she had when navigating the competitive waters of various industries.

20 Minute Presentation from the Speaker

JA Personal Finance Program
Tuesday, October 25, 2022 4:00 PM
Thursday, November 3, 2022 5:00 PM
Google Calendar ICS

We are proud to partner with JA British Columbia and host JA Personal Finance, a unique experience empowering students with financial literacy so they can have a personal finance plan and clear goals for their financial security!

Canadian youth are growing up in a time when spending is easier than ever, and debt is a way of life. This problem is exacerbated by hectic family schedules, leaving parents with little time to teach their children about money management. Limited resources in schools mean that they are also not able to teach students critical financial skills that will keep them out of debt and help them succeed in life.

Personal Finance teaches students personal money management skills, including the key elements of personal finance such as spending wisely, budgeting, saving, investing and using credit. In addition, program volunteers employ interactive lessons to boost students' self-confidence, so they can immediately apply their new knowledge to their lives.

You don‚Äôt want to miss out on this opportunity!‚Å†


‚öôÔ∏è PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTS
‚úîÔ∏è Free-of-charge and 100% online
‚úîÔ∏è Recognize the role income plays in personal finances
‚úîÔ∏è Discover the importance of planning financial decisions
‚úîÔ∏è Identify high-dollar items and unexpected costs that require savings
‚úîÔ∏è Explain the importance of making and keeping a spending plan
‚úîÔ∏è Consider the types of expenditures that might go into a monthly budget
‚úîÔ∏è Express the need to make good credit decisions to avoid costly consequences
‚úîÔ∏è Assess potential risks to personal finances

üìÖ DATES & TIMES
Session 1: Tuesday, October 25, 2022
4:00 pm ‚Äì 5:00 pm PST
Session 2: Thursday, November 03, 2022
4:00 pm ‚Äì 5:00 pm PST

If you missed the live sessions, you could complete the Personal Finance program via JA Campus (https://jacampus.org/)Self-Directed Programs. This will allow you to experience the full program, self-enroll and work your way through the course at your own pace. Once you‚Äôve completed the program, you will be able to download a digital Certificate of Accomplishment.

Thursday, January 12, 2023
12:00 PM 1:00 PM
Google Calendar ICS

We will have our guest speaker Ted Lau¬†for an insightful one-hour storytelling session for Startup Ideas and Market Research.

Ted Lau¬†is the Owner and CEO of¬†Ballistic Arts. Founded in 2002, Ballistic Arts is an award-winning Lead Gneration Digital Marketing Agency that focuses on online lead generation and brand awareness for B2B Professional Service Firms and B2B Distributors and Manufacturers. Ballistic Arts has full divisions in lead generation digital marketing, graphic design, video production, and web development.

Their client roster includes Vancity, Seaspan, Canada's Digital Supercluster, Concord Pacific, ICBC, B2Gold, the Port of Vancouver, Century 21, Tim Hortons, KPMG, Seaspan, and Raymond James to name a few.

By marrying compelling creative content with precise lead conversion data, Ballistic Arts has successfully increased clients leads by up to 500%, while beating industry standard ad buys by 30-80%.

Recent awards include the Canadian Business Awards for Best Full-Service Digital Marketing Agency in BC, Canada's Top 100 Digital Agencies by Clutch, and Business of the Year Winner (11-30 Employees) by the Tri-Cities Chamber of Commerce. Ted is grateful to have built one of North America‚Äôs top Lead Generation Digital Marketing Agencies.

If you want to gain insight into what it takes to run a successful business, how to find startup ideas and test them through market research, this event is for you!¬†

Not only will you gain some valuable knowledge from our guest speaker, but you'll also have the opportunity to network with others. It's sure to be an informative and beneficial session for everyone involved!

There are many entrepreneurs around us. So, there are many ways to capture brilliant business ideas. The question is, where do entrepreneurs‚Äô business ideas come from? How did they find it?

Her company services more than¬†200+ local small business clients from many industries. She will be co-hosting an insightful one-hour workshop next week to share her experiences from a few of her client's stories about how they started businesses in B.C. and where they found their business ideas. V2RF Workshop | Canadian Personal financial planning with Penny Zhao
Tuesday, February 7, 2023
4:00 PM 5:00 PM
Google Calendar ICS
FINANCIAL PLANNING IS FOR EVERYONE!

Many Canadians think that financial planning is only about investing for retirement. It is‚Äîbut it's also so much more. Financial planning is more than budgeting, saving or the perfect investment strategy. It sets you on a course toward achieving your life goals through the proper management of your financial affairs. Whether you're a young person planning how to finance your education, a college graduate with some money to spend who is planning to pay off your debt, or a senior planning how to leave your assets to the next generation, financial planning is how you think ahead to make sure you achieve your goals.

Penny Zhao is a financial security advisor and training manager at Canada Life. She has 10 years of experience in the financial planning industry and has helped hundreds of clients achieve their financial goals. Penny also enjoys working with young people to set up their personalized financial plans to achieve a brighter future.



You don't want to miss this opportunity.

‚öôÔ∏è¬†EVENT HIGHLIGHTS

‚úÖ Free-of-charge and 100% online

‚úÖ¬†The four areas of basic financial planning

‚úÖ Case Study: Cash flow | Income Protection | Retirement | Estate planning

‚úÖ How do the four areas of basic financial planning work together?

‚úÖ Why everyone needs to be financially responsible and sound to live a less stressful life.

‚úÖ What primary methods and government programs will help the individual save money for retirement or an emergency fund?

04:50 pm - 05:00 pm Ending Remarks

Join us for an evening of inspiring storytelling and insightful discussions on the journey of entrepreneurship. Dr. Tyler Grewal will share his personal experiences and valuable lessons learned from building successful businesses.

Dr. Tyler H. Grewal BSc Kin, DC; a graduate of Simon Fraser University with a bachelor of science degree in kinesiology and a doctorate in chiropractic from the University of Western States. His experience playing hockey and lacrosse led him to seek chiropractic care after sustaining injuries. He was inspired to provide similar services to others after experiencing a significant improvement in his health and well-being.


Through his stories, you'll gain practical knowledge and tips on how to start and grow a business, navigate challenges, and achieve your goals. You'll also have the opportunity to network with fellow entrepreneurs and business leaders, and exchange ideas and best practices.

12:00 PM 1:00 PM
Google Calendar ICS
Building Your Dream Business: Strategies for Success and Avoiding Common Pitfalls

It would be our honour to invite MNP Port Moody Team for hosting an insightful one-hour workshop session.

MNP Port Moody is a professional accounting firm located in Newport Village, at the heart of the Tri-Cities area, just off the Barnett Highway. With more than 30 professional team members, they offers a diverse suite of accounting, tax, and consulting services to clients. The firm's services include corporate restructuring, succession planning, business valuations, mergers and acquisitions, and non-resident tax planning.

MNP Port Moody works closely with private enterprises of all sizes, professionals, dealerships, not-for-profit organizations, and more. The firm's team takes pride in its deep roots in the community, making Port Moody and the Tri-Cities area a great place to live, work, and play.

Join us for a must-attend event for aspiring entrepreneurs. Learn from expert speakers as they share their insights and practical advice for building a successful business. Discover effective strategies for turning your idea into a reality, navigating challenges, and avoiding pitfalls along the way. 

This event will provide you with a solid foundation of knowledge and skills needed to build a successful business. Plus, you'll have the opportunity to network with like-minded individuals and build valuable connections that can help you along your entrepreneurial journey.

Don't miss out on this chance to gain essential knowledge, feel inspired, and take your business to the next level! Join us for this informative and engaging event to learn how to turn your dream business into a reality. 

Register now and take the first step toward achieving your entrepreneurial goals!

‚úÖ Expert speakers sharing their insights and practical advice

‚úÖ Tips and tricks for navigating challenges and avoiding common pitfalls

‚úÖ Real-world examples from successful entrepreneurs

Monday, March 27, 2023
7:30 PM 8:30 PM
Google Calendar ICS
Overcoming the Fear of Starting and Growing Your Business

Join us for an evening of inspiration and learning as we host an exciting event with successful entrepreneur and property manager, Keaton Bessey from Greater Vancouver Tenant & Property Management Ltd. 

Keaton Bessey is a successful entrepreneur and property manager with a passion for businesses. With over a decade of experience in the hospitality industry, he transitioned to property management and started his own company five years ago, achieving great success. Keaton continues to inspire others with his entrepreneurial journey and offers valuable insights on how to turn your passions into a successful business.

Keaton's entrepreneurial journey is sure to inspire you as he shares his stories of opening successful businesses, the feeling of being set up and excited to grow, and the understanding that the best-kept secrets are those no one knows about. He'll encourage you to stop worrying about putting things out there and explain why bad marketing never gets heard. Keaton will also share a bit about what they do, who they serve, and the story behind how they started.

In this event, we'll discuss the transition from wanting to own a business to actually starting one and growing it. We'll dive into the fear and doubt associated with opening a business when you don't really know what you're doing and share practical steps you can take to open a very low-risk business.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn, grow, and take the first steps toward making your entrepreneurial dreams a reality!RSVP now and join us for an evening of inspiration and learning.

Here is what you can expect at our workshop event on March 27, 2023, at 07:30 pm:

Change Your Mindset as Newcomers to Find Your Way
Wednesday, April 12, 2023
7:00 PM 8:00 PM
Google Calendar ICS
Are you a newcomer who is not sure how to adapt to your new life in Canada?

Come join us to talk to our presenter, Winnie Hsu and learn from her experience on how to find a way to learn and adapt to new country, community, language, and make friends with people with different backgrounds and cultures.

Winnie Hsu, the President & Founder of Vision2Reality Foundation, is a ¬†successful local business owner of NexGen Accounting Inc. for over 20 years. She started the Vision2Reality Foundation to assist newcomers and immigrants to start their own businesses in B.C.

During the session, ¬†Winnie will share her experience and success stories on how to achieve a successful career and new life in Canada as newcomer.

Registration required. ¬†This program will be offered using Zoom. To attend, please register with your email address.

We will share an invitation to the Zoom meeting by email 24 hours before the program. We may be unable to email invitations to the Zoom meeting if you register less than 60 minutes before the start of the program.

In Partnership with Vision2Reality Foundation

For more inquiries, please contact Shirley at schan@coqlibrary.ca

V2RF Storytelling with Francine Mbvoumbo | Building a legacy through intergenerational knowledge transfer
Thursday, April 20, 2023
4:00 PM 5:00 PM
Google Calendar ICS
Building a legacy through intergenerational knowledge transfer

Get ready to be inspired by the dynamic and accomplished¬†Francine¬†Mbvoumbo¬†as she takes center stage in "Building a legacy through intergenerational knowledge transfer"! This event is all about bringing together young and experienced professionals to discuss the importance of passing down valuable knowledge and skills from one generation to the next.¬†

Francine¬†Mbvoumbo, a Finance Professional with over seven years of experience in various industries, including Personal and Commercial Banking, Wealth Management, and Investor and Customer Communication Services, will share her insights on how intergenerational collaboration can help build a lasting legacy for future generations. As a Product Sales Executive, she focuses on developing strategic relationships and driving revenue growth through client digital transformation.¬†

In addition to her impressive professional accomplishments, Francine is also the founder and strategic leader of Mothers to Daughters (M2D), a for-impact organization that bridges the gap between younger women and more experienced women. She is a mentorship finalist with Women Empowerment Awards and has been recognized for her outstanding contributions to the community with awards such as the Legacy Award from Volunteer Toronto and being named among the¬†Top 100 Women to Watch¬†in Canada.

Join us for an engaging and inspiring conversation as we explore the value of intergenerational knowledge transfer and learn how it can help you build a legacy in your own professional and personal life. Whether you're just starting out in your career or have years of experience under your belt, this event is a must-attend! RSVP now and join us for an event of inspiration and learning.

Here is what you can expect at our storytelling event on April 20, 2023, at 04:00 pm:

04:00 pm - 04:05 pm Introduction

04:05 pm - 04:25 pm Presentation from the Speaker

04:25 pm - 04:50 pm FireSide chat and Q&A Session

04:50 pm - 05:00 pm Ending Remarks

Presented in Partnership with Mothers to Daughters (M2D), big thanks to Francine Mbvoumbo and the entire M2D team.

Wednesday, June 28, 2023

Google Calendar ICS
From Plan to Action - How Did I Register My Business in BC?¬†

Have you ever wondered about the process of registering a business in British Columbia? ü§î Join us for an insightful session where Kristen Iclef, a successful entrepreneur from Blitzkrieg Autowerks, will share her journey of registering her business and the challenges she overcame along the way. 

Kristen Iclef, a passionate entrepreneur, is the co-owner and operator of Blitzkrieg Autowerks, a specialty auto repair business located in Vancouver. With a strong focus on meeting the unique needs of vehicle owners, Blitzkrieg Autowerks offers a diverse range of services. While Kristen's husband expertly handles repairs and billing, she plays a crucial role in managing administrative tasks, ensuring smooth operations behind the scenes.

What sets Kristen and her husband apart is their unwavering dedication to their work, despite lacking formal business training. Their shared commitment has served as the driving force behind their achievements. From Monday to Friday, they work side by side, supported by a remarkable team and cherished by their loyal customers.

Join us at the V2RF Storytelling Event to hear Kristen Iclef share her inspiring story of how she and her husband registered their business in B.C. Learn about the challenges they faced and the strategies they employed to overcome them. Gain valuable insights and be inspired by their entrepreneurial journey.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn, grow, and take the first steps toward making your entrepreneurial dreams a reality!RSVP now and join us for an evening of inspiration and learning.

Thanks to¬†Vancity¬†for sponsoring the event!

Thursday, July 13, 2023
7:30 PM 8:30 PM
Google Calendar ICS
Navigating BC Business Regulations - Licenses and Permits for Success

Are you considering starting a business in British Columbia (BC) or already operating one? ü§îUnderstanding the licenses and permits needed to comply with the regulatory requirements is essential for your success. This workshop aims to provide you with the knowledge and insights necessary to navigate the intricacies of B.C.'s business regulations.

During this informative workshop, representatives from NexGen Accounting Inc., Tom Dao and Steven Li, will share their expertise on the licenses and permits required for various types of businesses operating in B.C. They will guide you through the process, clarifying the necessary steps and highlighting key considerations to ensure compliance. 

Whether you are a budding entrepreneur or an established business owner looking to expand, this workshop will equip you with the tools and understanding needed to streamline your operations and avoid potential pitfalls. Take advantage of this opportunity to ask questions, engage in discussions, and network with fellow business professionals.

‚öôÔ∏è EVENT HIGHLIGHTS

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†‚úÖ Free-of-charge and 100% online

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†‚úÖ Overview of BC's business licensing and permitting framework

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†‚úÖ Different types of licenses and permits relevant to your industry

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†‚úÖ Step-by-step guide to obtaining licenses and permits

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†‚úÖ Compliance and ongoing obligations for businesses

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†‚úÖ Common challenges and how to overcome them

¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†‚úÖ And much more!

About NexGen Accounting Inc.

NexGen Accounting Inc. has established itself as a reputable and reliable bookkeeping and accounting firm in British Columbia since 1998. With a strong track record of serving over a hundred small businesses, they have become a trusted partner in financial management.Their commitment to staying ahead of the curve has led to continuous investments in cutting-edge technology to meet the evolving needs of their clients.

Beyond their core services, NexGen Accounting Inc. has also demonstrated a commitment to supporting the local community. Through the Vision2Reality Foundation, they connect aspiring entrepreneurs with resources and professionals needed for success. This initiative has made a significant impact by empowering newcomers to Canada and enabling the establishment of new small businesses.

Additional Information:

Networking opportunities with fellow entrepreneurs.

Bring your questions for a Q&A session with the Representatives of NexGen Accounting Inc.


Don't miss this invaluable opportunity to gain insights from industry experts and enhance your understanding of the licenses and permits required to do business in BC. Reserve your spot today!

Join us for an engaging and inspiring virtual event. We are thrilled to have Chae Kim, the visionary founder of Earthling Foods, share her remarkable journey of acquiring the necessary licenses and permits to operate her thriving business.

Chae will take the virtual stage, captivating the audience with her personal narrative, and shedding light on the challenges, triumphs, and valuable insights she encountered throughout the licensing process. From navigating regulatory requirements to overcoming bureaucratic hurdles, Chae will offer a candid account of her experiences and provide practical tips for aspiring entrepreneurs.

Discover the strategies, resources, and unwavering perseverance that Chae employed to build Earthling Foods into a nationally recognized brand. Learn firsthand how she transformed her passion for crafting exquisite gluten-free pastries into a thriving wholesale manufacturing patisserie, with a mission to reinvent the bakery and snack aisle.

Whether you're an entrepreneur seeking guidance on licensing procedures or simply curious about Chae's incredible journey, this event promises to inspire, inform, and empower. Monday, August 21, 2023
4:30 PM 5:30 PM
Google Calendar ICS
Upcoming Event: V2RF Storytelling with Chris Chong | How I Manage My Taxes as a Small Business Owner .

ü§îAre you a small business owner looking to navigate the complexities of managing taxes effectively? üßæ Join us on August 21, 2023  for an exciting event featuring Chris Chong , the talented professional photographer and Director of Operations behind Butter Studios. üì∏ With over a decade of experience in successfully growing his own business, Chris is eager to share his expertise and insights on how he manages his taxes and financial responsibilities.

ü§ù About Chris Chong:

With a diverse background that includes a career in the telecommunications industry and years of experience running his own photography and videography company, Chris brings a unique perspective to the table. Having worked in both large corporations and the world of small businesses, he understands the challenges faced by entrepreneurs and the importance of managing quality control, enhancing client experiences, driving revenue growth, increasing efficiency, and ensuring long-term business sustainability. Most notably, Chris is passionate about helping small businesses and not-for-profit organizations achieve their goals through content creation and branding for their events. üìà

üîç Main Topics/Themes to Be Discussed:

‚úÖTax Management for Small Business Owners: Chris will dive into the essential aspects of managing taxes for small business owners. From understanding tax obligations to ensuring compliance, he'll share practical tips and strategies that will benefit both budding entrepreneurs and seasoned business owners.

‚úÖPutting Money Aside: A Crucial Step: One of the key challenges faced by many small business owners is setting aside funds for taxes. Chris will share his approach to budgeting and setting aside money regularly to avoid any surprises come tax time.

‚úÖThe Importance of Hiring a Knowledgeable Accountant: As a seasoned business owner, Chris understands the significance of having a competent accountant by your side. He will discuss the qualities to look for in an accountant, and the benefits of regular consultations beyond just tax-filing season. By fostering a close working relationship, entrepreneurs can uncover opportunities for tax optimization and financial growth.

‚úÖLeveraging Experience from Corporate to Small Business: With a background in the telecommunications industry, including roles in quality assurance, project management, and customer service, Chris brings a unique perspective to small business management. He'll explore how his experience in large corporations has contributed to effectively managing quality control, enhancing client experience, driving revenue growth, increasing efficiency, and ensuring the longevity of his own business.

üéâ Don't miss this opportunity to learn from a seasoned expert like Chris Chong and gain valuable insights into managing taxes as a small business owner. Mark your calendars, spread the word, and get ready for an informative and inspiring session! üéäReserve your spot today!

Special thanks to Vancity and IssofBC for sponsoring the event!

We hope to see you there! üëã

12:00 PM 1:00 PM
Google Calendar ICS
üöÄ Unlocking Success: V2RF Workshop on Mastering Insurance for B.C. Small Businesses with Expert Insights by Arthur Li

üôå Attention all B.C. small business owners! Are you ready to take your insurance knowledge to the next level? Join us for a transformative workshop designed to empower you with the expertise you need to conquer the insurance landscape.

üåü Special Guest Speaker: Arthur Li

Prepare to be inspired by the remarkable journey of Arthur Li, a veteran insurance professional who has left an indelible mark on the industry since his graduation in 1973. From his beginnings to his pivotal move to Vancouver in 1990, where he became a trailblazer in commercial underwriting, Arthur has amassed a lifetime of wisdom. Even after officially retiring in 2016, he continues to share his expertise by working part-time for an insurance broker. His accolades include the coveted Professional Designation of The Chartered Insurance Professional (CIP) & Fellow of Chartered Insurance Professional (FCIP) in 1994 & 1998, and the prestigious Certificate in Risk Management in 1997.

‚öôÔ∏è EVENT HIGHLIGHTS

‚úÖ Free-of-charge and 100% online

‚úÖGain insights into the intricate world of insurance for small businesses.

‚úÖUnderstand the key types of insurance coverage that are crucial for BC small business owners.

‚úÖLearn how to assess and manage risk effectively to protect your business assets.

‚úÖGet practical tips for optimizing your insurance coverage while managing costs.

‚úÖEngage in a dynamic Q&A session with Arthur Li, where you can seek personalized advice and answers to your burning insurance questions.

‚úÖAnd much more!

üéâ Why Attend?

Whether you're just starting your business or looking to refine your existing insurance strategy, this workshop is tailored to address your needs. Arthur's decades of experience will offer you invaluable insights and actionable advice, helping you make informed decisions to safeguard your business's future.

Get ready to embark on a journey of enlightenment, where you'll unravel the complexities of insurance with Arthur as your mentor. Your business's resilience starts here, and we can't wait to see you there! Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your understanding of insurance as a B.C. small business owner. We look forward to seeing you at the workshop and helping you navigate the world of business insurance with confidence!  Reserve your spot today!

Special thanks to Vancity and IssofBC for sponsoring the event!

Click Here to Sign Up / RSVP
We hope to see you there! üëã

FAQs
Find answers fast with the best FAQs.
What makes V2RF unique compared to other start-ups and small business support organizations?

We are an 100% online community that provides long-term support to start-up and small businesses owners. Not only do we provide resources, we also help our members develop a growth mindset that will benefit them in both their personal and professional lives. We are a truly multicultural, multigenerational and multi-industry community that welcomes people from all walks of life, and those who appreciate positive attitudes and are eager to learn from others.

What group will benefit the most from using V2RF‚Äôs programs and services?

V2RF can provide the most benefits to first or second generation immigrants and newcomers to British Columbia, Canada, who want to start their own businesses. Students of all ages with an entrepreneurial mindset can also benefit from our community. 

Does V2RF provide resources in other languages besides English?

While we currently only offer services in English, we plan on expanding to other languages in the future. Stay tuned!

Does V2RF provide practical resources if I plan to start a business in a Canadian province outside of BC?

No, not currently, as each province has its own regulations regarding business. You should contact your region‚Äôs support organization to get help. However, V2RF still welcomes you to join us, as the growth mindset attitude applies to all businesses.

Is V2RF a member-supported Non-profit organization? Where does the funding come from?

Yes, V2RF is a member-supported non-profit organization. Most of our funding comes from individual and corporate donors and sponsors/partners of our programs. 

Our day-to-day operations mainly depends on our committed board members, founders, staff and volunteers. 

Where can I find the most practical, step-by-step information if I want to start a business in BC?

We recommend you to: 

Check our online resources library on our community to get basic information

Check Small Business BC website: https://smallbusinessbc.ca/  

Check the Women Entrepreneur BC website: https://we-bc.ca/  

Check the Startup Canada website: https://www.startupcan.ca/

How can I get some support from local business professionals or ask a local business owner questions?

Join our online community by using the link below. We have many members within our community who are local business professionals and small business owners. There, you can network and find out who can help you and contact them directly. 

https://community.v2rf.org/ 

What is the most important attitude that an entrepreneur should have?

A Growth Mindset with a positive attitude. There will be many challenges to start and run a business. We believe that if a business owner has the right mindset,  they will create more opportunities for themselves to succeed. Please refer to our online community for many real life stories by other entrepreneurs. 

https://community.v2rf.org/

¬†Get Involved
Help Us Do More.

Here is where you can join the community of V2RF and get involved while building something together! 

Make a difference.

We're a not-for-profit organization that relies on support from people like you. Help us raise funds to create more programs and crucial resources for B.C. entrepreneurs. Please help keep Vision2Reality Foundation free for anyone, anywhere, forever.

Many small businesses fail in the first few years because they lack funding, support, and knowledge. Our online community will allow new business owners to meet professionals and learn how they overcame their challenges. This is what makes us unique - we offer ongoing support, no matter where you come from; if you have a dream and a vision, we would love to help you.¬†

Since we started our community in April 2022, over 250+¬†members have signed up. In addition, our series of business workshops, storytelling events and mentorship programs have attracted many attendees and helped budding entrepreneurs.¬†

For this fundraising campaign, our goal is to raise¬†$10,000,¬†which will be used to improve our programs. We need to attract passionate local business owners who want to share their stories and experiences to inspire others. In addition, we will need promotional material to reach more newcomers and immigrants and access better online delivery and recording applications to host and record our events, allowing more people to access our programs.

Help Us Do More
üíú
 Help Us Do More üíú
Join Our Family.

Without the dedication of volunteers, the passion of speakers or donations by donors and more, V2RF wouldn‚Äôt be able to be what it is today. So, help us help you. Let‚Äôs help more businesses start up and support more people in pursuing their dream and living it.

Feel free to contribute in more than one way and explore the sections for more information!

Meet Our People
Become a volunteer

By becoming a volunteer, you‚Äôll be able to join a dedicated team that is committed to helping the Vision2Reality community thrive. You‚Äôll meet like-minded people and make valuable connections, while also enjoying a sense of fulfillment by giving back to the community. As a volunteer, you will also be able to gain various types of business experience, such as Digital Marketing, Finance, Operations and more. 

Vision2Reality Foundation - Volunteer Application

Become a speaker - storytelling

You are a speaker, business owner, or professional who has proven that local start-ups are possible through growth mindsets. You resonate with your audience of aspiring leaders that building a business from scratch is undoubtedly a long journey of persistence and patience. Not only will your stories guide and motivate start-up owners, they will also remind you that you are on an ongoing business journey as well. You return the favour others have given you in the past. 

Become a speaker - workshops

You are a professional with extensive knowledge in your field of business and would like to share it with aspiring business owners. Our workshops will give you the perfect platform to do so. Each workshop will be guided by a theme, and through this interactive workshop, aspiring business owners can both learn from your experiences and leave with industry-relevant information and resources.  

Become a mentor

Perhaps someone lent you a hand when you first started your business, and you want to give back. Mentorship allows you to do so by making an active contribution to the next generation of professionals.

Become a sponsor

Sponsoring an event means that you‚Äôll be able to showcase your organization or business to more people. Sponsorship also means that you will be able to overtly show your support for our mission and values here at Vision2Reality. 

Become a partner

Working with other businesses allows us to expand our own knowledge and networks! We love working with other established organizations and businesses and look forward to the future that we can create together. 

Get in touch with us.

We'd love to hear from you. Select one of the options below to connect with the relevant team member.

Partnership Network.

Welcome to our partnership showcase, where we celebrate the generous support of our valued allies and organizations. Together, we strive to create a welcoming environment and provide essential resources for those starting a new chapter in their lives.

Join us in our mission of compassion, inclusivity, and empowerment. Together, we can build a stronger, more welcoming community for newcomers in our beautiful nation.

DISCOVER OUR REMARKABLE VISIONARY ORGANIZATIONS
 DISCOVER OUR REMARKABLE VISIONARY ORGANIZATIONS
Celebrating Collaborative Empowerment

PARTNERSHIP LEVELS

Program Sponsors

PROGRAM SPONSOR is an individual or organization that provides financial or other resources to support a program or initiative. 

PROGRAM SPONSORS are typically interested in promoting a particular cause or objective, and they provide resources to help achieve that goal.

PROGRAM SPONSORS may be involved in the planning and design of the program, but their primary role is to provide funding or other resources to support program implementation. They may also be recognized for their support of the program, and their involvement can help to build visibility and support for the program among other stakeholders.

Providing equitable financial services for community members while being committed to inclusivity and environmental campaigns. 

Visit Vancity here.

Helping immigrants build a future in Canada.

Visit ISSofBC here.

Empowering businesses with innovative cloud-based accounting and bookkeeping services for streamlined financial management.

Visit NexGen Accounting here.

Offering freight and crane services to commercial, residential, film, and government projects in British Columbia. 

Visit Phoenix Truck & Crane here.

Program Partners

PROGRAM PARTNER is an organization  who collaborates with our organization to implement a specific program or initiative. 

PROGRAM PARTNERS are typically selected based on their expertise in a particular field, their ability to contribute resources, and their alignment with the goals and objectives of the program. 

PROGRAM PARTNERS work closely with our organization to ensure that the program is successfully implemented and achieves its intended outcomes. They may contribute financial resources, personnel, or other forms of support to the program, and may also participate in program evaluation and assessment activities to help determine the program's effectiveness.

Providing client-focused accounting, consulting, tax, and digital services. 

Visit MNP (Port Moody Branch) here.

Delivering free hands-on, immersive education in work readiness, financial health, and entrepreneurship. 

Visit Junior Achievement of BC (JABC) here.

Empowering immigrant and refugee women and children through inclusive programs. 

Visit Pacific Immigrant Resources Society (PIRS) here.

Helping immigrants build a future in Canada.

Visit ISSofBC here.

Providing inclusive, innovative spaces and services that foster learning, knowledge, and engagement among Coquitlam's diverse communities.

Visit Coquitlam Public Library here.

Providing community-based learning environments.

Visit Douglas College here.

Community Partners

COMMUNITY PARTNER is an organization that collaborates with our  organization to achieve common goals related to community development, social impact, and other community-related initiatives. 

COMMUNITY PARTNERS are typically members of the community who have a vested interest in improving the well-being of their community and have expertise in a particular area that can be useful to the partnering organization. 

COMMUNITY PARTNERS often provide resources, knowledge, and support to help organizations implement programs or initiatives that benefit the community.

Empowering women entrepreneurs to make an impact in their communities and create opportunities in British Columbia‚Äôs economy.

Visit WeBC here.

Providing global business connections and trade documentation services to support businesses with resources.

Visit Surrey Board of Trade (SBOT) here.

Empowering young entrepreneurs to launch sustainable businesses through financing, mentorship, and resources.

Visit Futurpreneur here.

Empowering women for growth and legacy through intergenerational knowledge transfer, fostering social change.

Visit Mothers to Daughters (M2D) here.

Providing end-to-end in-country support for international students and alumni.

Visit Isempower here.

Delivering enjoyable and effective startup resources for entrepreneurs, providing the necessary tools for success.

Visit Creative Start-Up Academy here.

Join Us.

Are you passionate about empowering newcomers and creating a welcoming community in Canada? 

We invite you to explore the impactful partnership opportunities available with Vision2Reality Foundation. 

Together, let's build a brighter future for newcomers in Canada. Act now and be a catalyst for positive change!

Our Community
Meet Our Community.
Join Community
We're excited to have you hereüëã

Our Community is the simplest way to bring together network, entrepreneurial skills, events, practical resources, and leadership mindset ‚Äîall in one place.

Here at Vision2Reality Community, our goal is to help you:

Meet other entrepreneurs, local business professionals and business owners like you.

We are here to connect, share our stories and experiences, and learn from each other. We are here for the community.

Make better, more well-informed decisions

We can all exchange ideas, learn new strategies, and uncover new ways to successfully launch and grow our businesses.

Get answers

Get answers to the burning questions you can't just Google when it comes to launching a new business with the community at the center of it.

Find inspiration

About V2RF
Who We Are.

We're a not-for-profit organization that empowers and coaches newcomers in B.C. with a positive and inclusive mindset.

We are building a collaborative community to help B.C. start-ups and small business owners realize their vision. We give entrepreneurs the support they need by providing crucial resources and the opportunity to network with local business owners and professionals.

We are uniquely positioned to assist newcomers looking to create new lives through starting small businesses, by leveraging on our expertise in navigating the business environment.

üíú
Our Story.

It all started with Winnie, the founder of Vision2Reality Foundation. 30 years ago, Winnie came to Vancouver alone with only $1,000 in her pocket and no connections. Now she is the owner of a thriving business with wonderful staff and clients. After reflecting on her journey and hearing testimonials from her business partners, she realized that one of the largest obstacles start-up owners face is the lack of easy-to-access business resources and ongoing support. Often, resources are either buried by irrelevant articles or filled with hard-to-understand jargon. 

From here, the idea for Vision2Reality Foundation was born; 
a collaborative community for B.C. start-ups. We give entrepreneurs the support they need by providing crucial resources and the opportunity to network with local business owners and professionals.

Meet Our People
Our Mission.

Vision2Reality Foundation is a not-for-profit organization that empowers and coaches newcomers in B.C. with a positive and inclusive mindset. We foster innovation and encourage newcomers who are seeking to start their businesses through an online, integrated community.

Our Vision.

We believe that anyone who possesses a bold vision and a plan for success can overcome any obstacle to emerge as an industry leader. We aspire to support and help manifest the dreams of all motivated individuals, families, and communities through the promotion of entrepreneurship.

Our Values .
World Citizen

We believe everyone is a world citizen regardless of race, colour, age, gender, sexual orientation, cultural background and religion. Our commitment to Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion shows through our online community, where everyone respects, embraces and celebrates differences to grow stronger together.  

Creativity and Innovation

We pride ourselves in exercising creativity and innovation in improving our pillar programs by taking a step back to assess the needs of our members, and tailoring each and every experience to them.  

Warm and Close-knit Community

We promote a warm and close-knit community by supporting each other through online and offline engagement, with a heavy focus on community empowerment through encouraging everyone to share their stories on our platform. 

Accountability

We believe that accountability is key in building trust among people. As V2RF members, we are responsible for our actions, honest about our mistakes and make the best effort to correct and learn from them.

Celebration

Lastly, we celebrate with our team to make the journey more fun and cherish the small successes along with the big milestones.

Ready to dive in?

Join our community to meet amazing peers and entrepreneurs like you who successfully launch and grow their businesses.

Join Our Community

Virtual community that helps you turn your visions to reality

Vision2Reality Foundation is a 100% online, non-profit organization dedicated to helping newcomers to B.C. realize their business vision.

OUR STORY
JOIN COMMUNITY
Our People.

We‚Äôre steering Vision2Reality Foundation and lifting each other to grow together in our mission of connecting B.C. entrepreneurs with the tools, community, and support they need to start and build their businesses.

Learn More
Meet Our Community.

We are building a collaborative community filled with positive and like-minded individuals for networking and gaining mutual support for your business journey. No matter which stage of the business journey you are on, by joining our community, you will not only be able to build and advance your business, but also grow as an individual through adopting a positive growth mindset.

Cultivating your Vision

Do you have an idea, but are not sure how to start? Our community has you covered, and you‚Äôll find your path in no time through our workshops and events, or through chatting with like-minded business owners and professionals in the community.

Nurturing your Idea

You‚Äôve planted the seeds of your business, and they‚Äôve started to sprout! Now it is all about maintaining its growth and ensuring it stays in good shape. Our community can walk you through the next steps for your business and help you avoid common pitfalls by providing guidance through our Tri-Mentorship program, as well as answering your questions through our dedicated community rooms.

Blooming into Reality

You‚Äôve done it! Your business is starting to bloom, and you can finally reap the rewards of your hard work. Our community can walk you through the process of maximizing your growth and ensuring you‚Äôve planted new seeds to continue reaping the rewards in the future.

Learn more
Our Programs.
Workshop Series.
Description

Our dedicated series of workshops on various critical business topics, delivered by handpicked business owners and professionals. 

Storytelling.
Description

An interactive event with experienced business owners to hear about their obstacles during their start-up phase, and for you to ask questions you‚Äôve always wanted to learn more about. 

Tri-Mentoring Program.
Description

An opportunity to be paired with like-minded professionals in our community for dedicated guidance, while linking up with another Visionary for mutual support, facilitated by your dedicated V2RF Connector.

Events.

A sneak peek at our upcoming events and opportunities.
